The polynomial \(3x^{3}+pax^{2}+7a^{2}x+qa^{3}\) is denoted by \(\mathrm{f}(x)\), where \(p, q\) and \(a\) are constants and \(a \neq 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 106, 918, 138]]<|/det|>
When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((x+2 a)\) the remainder is \(-22 a^{3}\). When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((3 x-a)\) the remainder is \(-a^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 153, 328, 169]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\).
